## Developer Guide

If you are new to using `nbdev` here are some useful pointers to get you
started.

### Install wordslab_notebooks_lib in Development mode

``` sh
# make sure wordslab_notebooks_lib package is installed in development mode
$ pip install -e .

# make changes under nbs/ directory
# ...

# compile to have changes apply to wordslab_notebooks_lib
$ nbdev_prepare
```

## Usage

### Installation

Install latest from the GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/wordslab-org/wordslab-notebooks-lib):

``` sh
$ pip install git+https://github.com/wordslab-org/wordslab-notebooks-lib.git
```

or from
[conda](https://anaconda.org/wordslab-org/wordslab-notebooks-lib)

``` sh
$ conda install -c wordslab-org wordslab_notebooks_lib
```

or from [pypi](https://pypi.org/project/wordslab-notebooks-lib/)

``` sh
$ pip install wordslab_notebooks_lib
```

### Documentation

Documentation can be found hosted on this GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/wordslab-org/wordslab-notebooks-lib)’s
[pages](https://wordslab-org.github.io/wordslab-notebooks-lib/).
Additionally you can find package manager specific guidelines on
[conda](https://anaconda.org/wordslab-org/wordslab-notebooks-lib) and
[pypi](https://pypi.org/project/wordslab-notebooks-lib/) respectively.
